DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate whether social support-enhanced , technology-based , behavioral weight control intervention improve weight loss exist best practice .
DOC.detailed_description: This 4-month randomized control trial design investigate short-term efficacy feasibility novel , social support-enhanced behavioral weight control intervention . Participants recruit via email listservs , flier , word mouth . They randomize standard behavioral weight control treatment ( SBT ) social support-enhanced behavioral weight control treatment receive intervention SBT plus social support resource ( specifically , additional self-monitoring technology ) weight loss .
DOC.criteria: Body mass index ( BMI ) 25 kg/m2 55 kg/m2 Age 18 year old Access computer Internet connection Smartphone ownership ( Android iOS ) Willing randomize either one two study group Only one member household eligible participate Currently lactating , pregnant , plan become pregnant length study Been diagnose type 1 type 2 diabetes Medical physical contraindication limitation engage physical activity History major medical psychiatric condition Recent change medication know affect weight Schedule would prohibit restrict attendance designate time weekly person group meeting Currently participate weight management program Currently medication might affect weight loss
